---
title: "Hello World"
date: 2019-05-07
categories: ["R"]
tags: ["R"]
---


## R Markdown

This is my first post! This website was developed with R Markdown, Blogdown, Hugo, and served via Netlify. I tried hosting this on GitHub Pages, but had difficulty with Jekyll and the R Markdown format. Having read about Blogdown, I'm making the transition.

So far this is great. I can embed R code like this:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(cars)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00  
```


:::
:::



Or include plots:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie(
  c(280, 60, 20),
  c('Sky', 'Sunny side of pyramid', 'Shady side of pyramid'),
  col = c('#0292D8', '#F7EA39', '#C4B632'),
  init.angle = -50, border = NA
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](2019-05-07-hello_world_files/figure-html/sky-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


---


I don't anticipate blogging a lot, but I hope to make this a platform to showcase some of my pet projects. Fair warning, a lot of my projects revolve on my dog, Harper, so I literally mean "pet". Below are a few examples I hope to post about soon:

* Raspberry Pi timelapse video of Harper crate-training
* Harper/Not Harper image classification mobile app
* Harper autoencoder to generate new, "fake" Harper images

---
